intro: Litogyne scabra, commonly known as the rough litogyne, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its rough, bark-like texture on its stems. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Litogyne scabra is generally found in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid regions.
